question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What genre did Arista All Stars concert have around 1990?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Arista All Stars Concert

The Arista All Stars concert, held on July 22, 1978, at the Montreux Jazz Festival, was a musical performance that showcased the talents of various artists under the Arista Records label. The concert was a celebration of jazz music, featuring a diverse range of musicians and styles within the genre. Jazz as a Musical Style and Genre

Jazz is a musical style and genre that originated in the southern United States in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. It is characterized by its improvisational nature, blues and swing influences, and a mix of traditional and experimental instrumentation. Jazz has evolved over the years, incorporating various sub-genres such as swing, bebop, cool jazz, and Latin jazz, among others. Evidence of the Arista All Stars Concert's Jazz Genre

The Arista All Stars concert, featuring a lineup of renowned jazz musicians, provides strong evidence of its connection to the jazz genre. The concert's roster included jazz legends such as:

* Grover Washington Jr., a saxophonist and composer known for his smooth jazz and R&B-infused sound [1]
* Bob James, a pianist and keyboardist who has worked with numerous jazz and R&B artists [2]
* Eric Gale, a guitarist who has played with jazz and R&B musicians such as Grover Washington Jr. and Bob James [3]
* Harvey Mason, a drummer who has worked with jazz and R&B artists such as Herbie Hancock and George Benson [4]

The concert's setlist, which included jazz standards and original compositions, further supports its classification as a jazz performance. The Montreux Jazz Festival, one of the most prestigious jazz festivals in the world, provided a platform for the Arista All Stars to showcase their jazz talents to a global audience. References:

[1] Grover Washington Jr. biography on AllMusic
[2] Bob James biography on AllMusic
[3] Eric Gale biography on AllMusic
[4] Harvey Mason biography on AllMusic

The Arista All Stars concert, with its lineup of accomplished jazz musicians and jazz-oriented setlist, provides conclusive evidence of its connection to the jazz genre.
content.source_2: In the year 2031, the world of entertainment was on the cusp of a revolution. The lines between music, television, and drama were blurring, and the Arista All Stars concert was about to become a pioneering force in this new era. It all began on a sweltering summer evening in 1978, when the Montreux Jazz Festival played host to the iconic Arista All Stars concert. The event, which took place on July 22nd, was a celebration of music, featuring some of the biggest names in the industry. Little did anyone know that this concert would be the catalyst for a groundbreaking television series that would captivate audiences decades later. Fast-forward to 2031, and the world was a vastly different place. Virtual reality had become an integral part of daily life, and the entertainment industry was struggling to keep up. That's when a group of visionary producers stumbled upon the footage of the 1978 Arista All Stars concert. They saw an opportunity to create something entirely new â€“ a drama television series that would transport viewers back in time to that magical summer evening. The series, also titled "Arista All Stars," premiered in 2031 to critical acclaim. It was a genre-bending masterpiece, blending music, drama, and nostalgia in a way that had never been seen before. The show's creators used advanced AI technology to recreate the concert in stunning detail, complete with virtual performances by the original artists. As the series progressed, it became clear that "Arista All Stars" was more than just a nostalgic trip. It was a commentary on the power of music to bring people together, to transcend time and space. The show's writers wove a complex narrative around the concert, exploring the lives of the musicians, the organizers, and the fans who attended that fateful night. Over the course of three seasons, from 2031 to 2034, "Arista All Stars" became a cultural phenomenon. It sparked a renewed interest in the music of the 1970s, and inspired a new generation of artists to create their own unique sound. The show's influence extended beyond the entertainment industry, too, as it brought people together in a way that few other things could. In the end, "Arista All Stars" was a testament to the enduring power of music and drama. It showed that even the most unlikely of events could be transformed into something truly remarkable, given the right vision and creativity.
